verses.text: 在士師統治期間，國內發生了饑荒。有一個人帶著妻子和兩個兒子，從猶大的伯利恆前往摩押地去，寄居在那裡。

words.note: Refers to the leaders and judges of ancient Israel.
Indicates completion or a new situation.
Indicates a continuous state or action.
摩押 (Moab) + 地 (land)
Serves as a directional complement here.

verses.heading: A Family Tragedy: Famine and Death

verses.text: 這個人名叫以利米勒，妻子名叫拿俄米，兩個兒子叫瑪倫和基連，都是猶大伯利恆的以法他人。他們到了摩押地，就在那裡住下來了。

words.note: Refers to people from Ephrath, another name for Bethlehem.
Indicates completion of an action.
摩押 (Moab) + 地 (land)
A verb-complement construction meaning to settle or remain.
Indicates a change of state or new situation.

verses.text: 後來拿俄米的丈夫以利米勒去世了，留下她和兩個兒子。

words.note: A polite term for 'to die'.
Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 他們娶了摩押女子作妻子，一個名叫俄耳巴，一個名叫路得。他們在那裡住了約有十年。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
Indicates completion or duration of action.

verses.text: 後來，瑪倫和基連二人也死了，留下拿俄米，既沒有了兩個兒子，又沒有了丈夫。

words.note: Indicates completion or a change of state.
Often used with '又' to mean 'neither...nor' or 'both...and'.
Indicates a change of state or situation.
Paired with '既' to mean 'neither...nor' or 'both...and'.
Indicates a change of state or situation.

verses.text: 拿俄米還在摩押地的時候，因為聽說耶和華眷顧他的子民，賜糧食給他們，就帶著兩個媳婦動身從摩押地回來。
她離開居住的地方，兩個媳婦也隨她出發，要回到猶大地去。
verses.heading: Ruth Returns with Naomi

verses.text: 拿俄米對兩個媳婦說：「去吧，你們還是各自回娘家吧。願耶和華恩待你們，像你們善待已死的人和我一樣。

words.note: More formal than '死了的'

verses.text: 願耶和華使你們各人有機會再嫁（「有機會再嫁」原文作「在丈夫家裡」），找到歸宿。」跟著親吻她們，她們就發聲大哭，
說：「不，我們一定要跟你一起回到你同胞那裡去。」

words.note: Lit. 'same womb'; refers to people of the same nation or family.

verses.text: 拿俄米說：「我女兒啊，你們回去吧，為甚麼要跟我去呢？我肚子裡還有兒子作你們的丈夫嗎？

words.note: Can also be a verb meaning 'to follow'.
Lit. 'inside the belly'.

verses.text: 走吧，我女兒啊，你們回去吧，因為我太老，不能嫁人了，就算我說我還有希望今天晚上有個丈夫，又生兒子，
你們可以等到他們長大嗎？你們可以為他們守節而不嫁人嗎？不行，我女兒啊，我為你們非常難過，因為耶和華伸手對付我。」

words.note: Can also be a preposition indicating arrival or result.
Lit. 'keep integrity/chastity'.
Lit. 'not ordinary'.
Lit. 'difficult to pass through'.
Contextually, 'afflict' or 'act against'.

verses.text: 她們又放聲大哭。俄耳巴就和婆婆吻別，路得卻捨不得離開拿俄米。

words.note: Lit. 'release sound'.
Lit. 'big cry'.
Lit. 'cannot bear to part with'.

verses.text: 拿俄米說：「你看，你嫂嫂已經回到她同胞和她的神那裡去了。你也跟著嫂嫂回去吧。」

words.note: Indicates direction or completion of action.
Lit. 'same womb'.

verses.text: 路得說：「請不要逼我離開你回去，不跟從你。你到哪裡去，我也要到哪裡去；你在哪裡過夜，我也要在哪裡過夜；你的同胞就是我的同胞，你的 神就是我的 神；

words.note: Both characters mean 'to follow'.
Lit. 'same womb', referring to people of the same origin/country.
The space before '神' indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
The space before '神' indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 你死在哪裡，我也要死在哪裡，葬在哪裡。除非死亡把你我分離；如果我離開你，願耶和華加倍懲罰我。」

words.note: Grammar particle for direct object before verb.

verses.text: 拿俄米看路得堅決要跟她走，就不再多費唇舌了。

words.definition: to want to, be going to

words.note: Lit. 'lips and tongue'; refers to talking or persuading.

verses.text: 她們雙雙上路，來到伯利恆。她們到達的時候，全城都因她們的緣故騷動起來。婦女們說：「這是拿俄米嗎？」

words.definition: to set out, hit the road

words.note: Directional complement, indicates beginning of an action.

verses.text: 拿俄米對她們說：「不要叫我拿俄米，叫我瑪拉吧，因為全能者使我吃盡了苦頭。

words.note: Lit. 'all-powerful one', a title for God.
Lit. 'eat to the fullest extent', implying suffering completely.

verses.heading: Naomi and Ruth Arrive in Bethlehem

verses.text: 我滿滿地出去，耶和華卻使我空空地回來，你們為甚麼還叫我拿俄米呢？耶和華折磨我，全能者加害於我。」

words.note: Contextually 'afflict' rather than 'torture'.
Refers to God; Lit. 'all-able person'.
Classical Chinese preposition, often replaced by 在/對 in modern usage.

verses.text: 拿俄米就這樣回來了。她媳婦摩押女子路得隨著她從摩押地回來。她們到達伯利恆，正是開始收割大麥的時候。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
A verb-object compound, literally 'collect and cut'.
Connects an attribute to a noun, similar to 'of' or '-ing'.
